page.title: 07Riding Stables,Pen-y-van.
page.content: The riding stables at Pen-y-Van have been established for 35 years. They are owned and managed by a local lady. There are 6 horses and 13 ponies which are stabled on site on the 6.75 acres of land. A typical day would include lessons for about 20 people in groups, at hourly intervals.In the summer, with tourists, there may be up to 60 visitors a day.Rides are taken on site or in nearby woodland. It costs Â£3.00 for children and Â£4.00 for adults per lesson.The horses and ponies are fed on hay and horse nuts.The horses are shod every three months. Many local people, especially children, take advantage of the facilities offered, and local children also enjoy grooming the horses and ponies and helping to muck out the stables.
